required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: rTMS in Aphasic Patients With Neuroimage Assessments
clinical_study.official_title: Synchronous rTMS and Computer-integrated Speech Training Applied in Aphasic Patients

brief_summary.textblock: The refinement of repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation (rTMS) has highlighted its merit in terms of learning programs as a treatment for aftereffect augmentation. Nevertheless, the efficacy of synchronous rTMS protocol integrated with computer-integrated speech training is not well understood. It is also not clear regarding the efficacy of compound bi-hemispheric stimulation protocol. The aim of the study is to investigate language response to these new strategies and to determine the longevity of the therapeutic outcome. Advanced MR neuroimaging techniques, such as fMRI and DTI, are powerful tools to evaluate the concomitant nervous changes after rTMS treatment on aphasic patients. The knowledge from fMRI and DTI microstructural evolution provides insight into underlined mechanism operating the language improvement.

detailed_description.textblock: The efficacy of synchronous rTMS protocol integrated with computer-integrated speech training is not well understood. It is also not clear regarding the efficacy of inhibitory or excitatory stimulation protocol. The aim of the study is to investigate language response to these new strategies and to determine the longevity of the therapeutic outcome. Advanced MR neuroimaging techniques, such as fMRI and DTI, are powerful tools to evaluate the concomitant nervous changes after rTMS treatment on aphasic patients. The knowledge from fMRI and DTI microstructural evolution provides insight into underlined mechanism operating the language improvement

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in aphasia level on the Concise Chinese Aphasia Test (CCAT) at 2 Weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in the concomitant nervous status on the Functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI) at 2 weeks

arm_group.description: repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation (rTMS) intervention of contralesional 1Hz-rTMS for 10 daily sessions.
Sham treatment for 2-week inhibitory non-dominate hemisphere rTMS program.
High-frequency rTMS to ipsilesional region for 10 daily sessions.

intervention.description: undergo contralesional 1Hz repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation(rTMS) or high frequency ipsilesional rTMS for 10 daily sessions

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Aphasic stroke in chronic stage (over 3 months)
Exclusion Criteria:
- No seizure history, no brain surgery history, no electronic device in brain or chest, no dementia

overall_official.affiliation: Department of physical medicine and rehabilitation, Taipei Veterans General Hospital

reference.citation: Tsai PY, Wang CP, Ko JS, Chung YM, Chang YW, Wang JX. The persistent and broadly modulating effect of inhibitory rTMS in nonfluent aphasic patients: a sham-controlled, double-blind study. Neurorehabil Neural Repair. 2014 Oct;28(8):779-87. doi: 10.1177/1545968314522710. Epub 2014 Feb 13.
